snippet: An escalating campaign against President Obama’s get-tough policies is having an effect on the deporter in chief.
abstract: Editorial contends Pres Obama's response to immigration advocates that he can do little to help the 11 million immigrants stranded outside the law is disingenuous; notes Congress is no place to find hope of reform and Obama has already used his discretion wisely, to halt deportations of young illegal immigrants; holds until Obama acts on his own to shield more immigrants from deportation, his concern seems shallow.
lead_paragraph: An escalating campaign against President Obama’s get-tough policies is having an effect on the deporter in chief.
